level.text: To determine the lowest evaluated bid price, the contracting officer shall compare the lowest evaluated offer on the first fiscal year alternative against the lowest evaluated offer on the multiyear alternative, as follows:
Multiply the evaluated unit price for each item of the lowest evaluated offer on the first fiscal year alternative by the number of units of that item required by the multiyear alternative;
Add the total amount for all the items to the dollar amount of any administrative costs identified in the solicitation; and
Compare the result of the computations performed under ยง2003.1(a) and (b) against the total evaluated price of the lowest offer on the multiyear alternative.
If the multiyear procurement is being computed on a basis other than price alone, the contracting officer shall conduct the evaluation based on the evaluation factors contained in the solicitation.
